Overwatch 2 from ( even before ) day one is an absolute lie. All the players have been lied to and it is disgusting to me that a game I once loved has been reduced to this smoking pile of microtransaction hell.

Will I keep playing it? Maybe. We will see what the future brings.

Will I spend money on it? Absolutely no chance in hell.

I have 2500+ hours on Overwatch since its launch in 2016. A lot of the 'criticisms' people are giving for this game are comments from spoiled children, Overwatch is getting flack for doing the same things that every other F2P game on the market does. A lot of the monetization problems people have are abundant in the F2P genre, I mean look at Valorant. I understand why it would leave a sour taste in people's mouths due to the shift from Overwatch 1's model, but that model was unsustainable and outdated. 

This game has probably the worst balance out of any major game on the market, and stability and other issues seem to continue to plague the game going forward. 5v5 has also been an odd decision as the game has aged. 

However, with all that being said I think this is a fun game. I enjoy playing this game with my friends. There is no other multiplayer game I have played that matches this game in terms of pacing and style. Also the characters in this game are unmatched, no other hero shooter in this world has a character that is anywhere near the level of Winston Overwatch. It is free so there is literally no barrier to entry and I can recommend it to someone to try without any guilt. It's nice to see the game getting content again.

I liked Overwatch 1, Overwatch 2 stripped away most of the things besides the core gameplay loop that added depth and character to the game. I miss what it used to be, it doesn't deserve higher than a 3/10 overall. Its core gameplay is still pretty alright, and its free. but everything else is dogshit.

After paying full price for a PC copy of Overwatch 1 I was expecting to be able to play the PVE content in the sequel free of charge, as I had already paid for a game that is now free. Then I found out everything promoted in the trailers for the sequel wasn't even in the game at launch. They also changed the way you unlock new heroes, instead of playing them on release day like in Overwatch 1 (or on the earlier on the PTR free of charge) you could either pay around ¬£5 every time a new hero was released or play the game a significant amount to unlock a piece of content that was given freely to every player previously. They also removed the PTR (An option for players to play test content yet to be released).

Now, nearly a year later I have come back once again to find I have to pay ¬£12.99 just to play 3, probably underdeveloped story missions (I haven't played the paid missions but the free one was lackluster, comparable to the archives missions in Overwatch 1). Most of the advertised content over the last 5 years is not even in the final product that was released today, one such feature is hero talent trees which I was looking forward to when it was announced half a decade ago. I can't believe they expect people to pay this price when you can play many entire story games for the same price and it isn't just an addition to an already existing product (a good example is The Witcher 3, which is far cheaper on a sale).

Overall, I advise anyone playing this game to stop supporting a company that exploits its player base so often. A company not delivering with promised content and turning the game into a micro-transaction farm, not caring about the quality of their once beloved game. Overwatch 2 is an embarrassment to video games.

Overwatch 2 seems to have undergone some changes compared to Overwatch 1. One noticeable difference is the removal of the leveling system, which previously allowed players to earn lootboxes and obtain skins without any cost. Now it appears that each skin comes with a price tag of 20‚Ç¨ as most of the content is locked behind a paywall. Additionally they have introduced a Battlepass system that may create a fear of missing out (FOMO) pressuring players to spend money if they haven't played enough to level it up.

Initially there were promises of a Story mode, with its leveling system, which played a role in their decision to retire Overwatch 1. However they later decided against implementing this mode and instead introduced story snippets that last around 30 minutes. Accessing these snippets now comes at a cost of 15‚Ç¨. In contrast in Overwatch 1 these levels were both free and offered opportunities for players to earn lootboxes and receive rewards at no expense.

It's hard not to view this game as an attempt by Blizzard to maximize profits. They have taken away what used to be an rewarding gaming experience from us. Instead we are left with what feels like a downgraded version of Overwatch 1 accompanied by an, in game shop.

[h1] Monetisation kills [/h1]

Firstly it should be stated I have roughly 1500 hours across all platforms, this is time spent across both Overwatch 1 and 2.

I do believe this game used to be good back during OW1 but ever since the shift to OW2 the monetisation has really put me off this game

Overwatch 1 had the lootbox system and whilst lootboxes in gaming are looked down upon by most, overwatch 1 had one of the best implemented lootbox systems. Featuring a good chance to receive high rarity goods, duplicate protection and lacked much of the inflated cosmetics we have now (Souvenirs and weapon charms) which most players do not care about.

Now with Overwatch 2 the lootbox system was removed and instead they have full on capitalised on [b]FOMO[/b] (Fear If Missing Out) by implementing the ever more and more popular battlepass system into their game which people have different views on the battlepass system, personally I believe some can be good but I also do not like the idea of how much they pry on FOMO.

The Overwatch battlepass is one of the worst I have ever seen in modern games which feature them for multiple reasons
[list]
    [*]You do not make back the currency you spent on it meaning each season if you wanna finish the battlepass you need to spend the 1000 overwatch coins again.
    [*]No battlepass theme; The battlepass can be based around a theme but the items in the battlepass do not always make sense with the theme and items that would make sense in the battlepass are put into the [b]rotating store[/b] (more on that soon).
    [*]Highly inflated battlepass; The battlepass is absolutely full to the brim of useless junk which take up most of the space, multiple souvenirs, weapon charms, sprays, player icons, voice lines. Whilst having some of this junk in the battlepass may be normal across some other games, most other games do not require you to spend $10~ each season for a new battlepass and will normally allow you to make your currency back, some games rewarding extra.
    [*]New characters are locked behind the battlepass with you either being able to unlock them instantly if you purchase the battlepass or if you progress to halfway through the battlepass if you do not pay for it.
[/list]

The rotating store they have in the game is also horrendous. Full of horrible pricing on cosmetics costing upwards of $20~ on a single cosmetic and predatory bundles with more outrageous pricing which most players do not know that if you choose to buy cosmetics through the "Hero Gallery" you are able to buy the cosmetics individually.

It would be unfair for me though to not include a key piece of information. You are able to acquire their premium currency without having to spend any money through the weekly challenges included in game. The only issue with this is the amount you do get is abysmally low compared to the prices items in the game, if you do complete every single weekly challenge for that week the maximum amount of premium credits you can get are capped to 60.

To add onto this further, added this season was the introduction of the pve gamemode which is a shadow of what was formerly promised when its reveal YEARS ago. to be able to play the pve modes at all you must sink a minimum of $15 for access.

It is sad to see what this game has become overtime and is now just a greedy corporate cashgrab with the game quality greatly decreases in favour of micro transaction profits.

Pros:
- Free to play
- Relatively pretty game
- Enough heroes to play not to get bored
- Enough game modes to keep you entertained

Cons:
- Free to play - little kids and trolls mess up everything
- Battle pass - almost no bang for you buck
- NO PvE AS PROMISED
- The community 
- Grind, Grind, Grind 
- 15 EUR to have the PvE missions 
- Not at all interesting and engaging 
- No access to OW1

Honestly, it WAS a pretty nice game, but someone came and ruined everything for everyone because they got greedy. I hope none of the teams that worked on the game take this personally, because they did a hell of job given the circumstances.

Overwatch was once a truly great game. This trash is just a hollow shell of what it used to be. Well, not so hollow it is filled to the brim with micro transactions...anyways yeah fuck this game. Calling this Overwatch "2" is a joke. All Blizzard did was take a good game, make it free to play, fill it with purchasable items, and make more heroes gay.

I bought this game on the Playstation 4 back in 2016 after playing it for a bit when the free weekend deal came out. Despite not being good, I had fun maining Bastion and playing characters like Genji and Mcree, not to mention custom lobbies of tag and hide n seek. I would play the game for about a year before picking up other titles and kind of forgetting about it, always remembering it as a good game. So to my disappointment, coming back to Overwatch 2 in October on my PC, finding it to be a shell of what it used to be, with all the battlepass and microtransactions shoved in your face (sure, loot boxes were a literal gamble, but at least it wasn‚Äôt entirely paywalled, excluded characters, and was a copy paste mess), playing it only for a week, then for the PvE, the one thing I, and everyone else, had some hope for, to be canceled after years in the making, with so many promises, over to now, where a PvE mission is being sold for $15, it is a shame, but no longer a surprise, to see this game fall so far. I hope Blizzard takes the wave of negative reviews with even a grain of salt to see that the way they are doing things will not fly, and soon enough they won‚Äôt be able to afford to keep servers online. I, like many others, only downloaded this game to put in a bad review, but at least in mine, I have something more to say (not to say I don‚Äôt find many of them funny).
